title: Should all people, regardless of race, be held accountable for their own actions? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. And unfortunately, some people are still immersed in tribal mindset. They did not, and would not create anything meaningful, thus not qualified to be considered civilised. Needless to say, there is little direct correlation between European imperialism and the new murderous weltanschauung pushed for by the Third World radical politicians/cronies/ideologues today. The fact is that the discourse of today’s decivilisers, be they non-Western/European or from the stubborn, unattached political communities, draws heavily on a repertoire which revives, willingly or not, the centuries-old imperial languages and several imperial myths. Accountability means something socially marginalised in the context of their racist hate speech and atrocity propaganda , I argue, as they have never been accountable for their own peoples.

You bet. As we all know, circumstances of birth and upbringing have no effect on character development. There’s no such thing as PTSD. Mental illness is a socialist hoax. People just decide whether to be good or bad, lazy or indusstrious, at around age 10. However, if someone is a Republican, they are never responsible for anything bad—it’s always someone else’s fault, as their party’s leader makes clear every day.
